.NET Framework 3.5.name: VRTK_HeadsetControllerAware
.NET Framework 3.5.summary: The purpose of Headset Controller Aware is to allow the headset to know if something is blocking the path between the headset and controllers and to know if the headset is looking at a controller.
.NET Framework 3.5.example: VRTK/Examples/029_Controller_Tooltips displays tooltips that have been added to the controllers and are only visible when the controller is being looked at.

methods.name: CheckHeadsetView(GameObject controller, Transform customDestination, bool controllerGlance, bool controllerGlanceLastState)
methods.syntax: protected virtual void CheckHeadsetView(GameObject controller, Transform customDestination, bool controllerGlance, bool controllerGlanceLastState)
methods.linkedSyntax: protected virtual void CheckHeadsetView(GameObject controller, Transform customDestination, bool controllerGlance, bool controllerGlanceLastState)

methods.name: GlanceStateChanged(GameObject controller, bool glance)
methods.syntax: protected virtual void GlanceStateChanged(GameObject controller, bool glance)
methods.linkedSyntax: protected virtual void GlanceStateChanged(GameObject controller, bool glance)

methods.name: LeftControllerGlanced()
methods.summary: the LeftControllerGlanced method returns the state of if the headset is currently looking at the left controller or not.
methods.returns: Returns true if the headset can currently see the controller within the given radius threshold.

methods.name: LeftControllerObscured()
methods.summary: The LeftControllerObscured method returns the state of if the left controller is being obscured from the path of the headset.
methods.returns: Returns true if the path between the headset and the controller is obscured.

methods.name: ObscuredStateChanged(GameObject controller, bool obscured, RaycastHit hitInfo)
methods.syntax: protected virtual void ObscuredStateChanged(GameObject controller, bool obscured, RaycastHit hitInfo)
methods.linkedSyntax: protected virtual void ObscuredStateChanged(GameObject controller, bool obscured, RaycastHit hitInfo)

methods.name: OnEnable()
RayCastToController(GameObject controller, Transform customDestination, bool obscured, bool lastState)
methods.syntax: protected virtual void RayCastToController(GameObject controller, Transform customDestination, bool obscured, bool lastState)
methods.linkedSyntax: protected virtual void RayCastToController(GameObject controller, Transform customDestination, bool obscured, bool lastState)

methods.name: RightControllerGlanced()
methods.summary: the RightControllerGlanced method returns the state of if the headset is currently looking at the right controller or not.
methods.returns: Returns true if the headset can currently see the controller within the given radius threshold.

methods.name: RightControllerObscured()
methods.summary: The RightControllerObscured method returns the state of if the right controller is being obscured from the path of the headset.
methods.returns: Returns true if the path between the headset and the controller is obscured.

methods.name: SetHeadsetControllerAwareEvent(RaycastHit raycastHit, VRTK_ControllerReference controllerReference)
methods.syntax: protected virtual HeadsetControllerAwareEventArgs SetHeadsetControllerAwareEvent(RaycastHit raycastHit, VRTK_ControllerReference controllerReference)

methods.name: Update()

events.name: ControllerGlanceEnter
events.summary: Emitted when the controller is seen by the headset view.

events.name: ControllerGlanceExit
events.summary: Emitted when the controller is no longer seen by the headset view.

events.name: ControllerObscured
events.summary: Emitted when the controller is obscured by another object.

events.name: ControllerUnobscured
events.summary: Emitted when the controller is no longer obscured by an object.
